data.title: Scott Monument
data.meta_description: Discover one of Edinburgh's most iconic landmarks. We offer fully guided tours daily from 10am. Please note that the Scott Monument is only able to take card payments at the moment. We apologise for any inconvenience.
data.text:
ON FOOT

The monument is prominent city centre landmark on Princes Street in the heart of Edinburgh.

BY BIKE

NCR1 runs along George Street, parallel to Princes Street. Turn towards Princes Street at Hanover Street or St Davids Street for the Scott Monument.

BY TRAIN

Leave Waverley Station by the Princes Street exit; look left (west) on Princes Street and you can see the monument. To reach it, walk west, to the monument in Princes Street Gardens.

BY BUS/TRAM

Many city bus routes pass by or close to the East end of Princes Street. The tram route also has stops along Princes Street.

PARKING

There is no parking close to the monument; the nearest metered parking is on Market Street or George Street. Secure off-street parking is also available off the east end of Princes Street in the NCP car parks at Waverley and Greenside Place
